posts.post: I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as General Manager, Italy at Coca-Cola HBC!

This week begins an exciting new chapter in my career as I become the General Manager for CCHBC Italy. The business and people of Italy hold a special place in my heart, it is where I began my career in CCHBC, and started my family. However, it is also a time where I say goodbye to the people and business in Ireland and Northern Ireland. The last 3 1/2 years have the most rewarding of my career as we navigated some tough times but emerged stronger.  I will miss many things from the Island of Ireland, but most of all the people; the kindness, humility and humor of the people are so special and unique. Thank you to everyone that made me feel welcome and for making it such a great experience.

It’s been a big week. On Tuesday we had the honour of hosting the UK Prime Minister, Rishi Sunak MP, on what was a proud and historic day for our business .  This event came a day after the agreement of the Windsor Framework, a deal that protects businesses like ours and provides much needed certainty.  The Prime Minister took time to answer questions from our Northern Ireland based employees and it was encouraging to hear him speak passionately about future prosperity and opportunity for all the people of Northern Ireland.

July marked the launch of our sixth hashtag#YouthEmpowered programme. This Coca-Cola HBC group wide initiative is designed to empower young people to overcome barriers to education and employment through skills and training.  I was delighted to join Minister Heather Humphreys to launch this year’s programme which is being delivered in partnership with @An Cosán and with YouthAction NI. In 2022 we aim to reach over 2,000 young people across the island of Ireland. https://lnkd.in/e7R5m9g5hashtag#YouthEmpowered hashtag#DiscoverDevelopSucceed

At Coca-Cola HBC, we have a vision for a world without waste. We understand that we need to be part of the solution and this €13m investment demonstrates our serious commitment to reducing plastic waste.  Over the last two years we have reduced our plastic use by 5000 tonnes annually, through the use of recycled plastic and the elimination of plastic from our multipack cans. But, as always, there is more to do. We strive to create a true circular economy for packaging in Ireland and Northern Ireland and are willing partners in the creation of world-class collection and recycling schemes.  With sustainability at the heart of our business and our industry, I’m confident that together we can make the world a better place.
A great job done by the whole Coca-Cola Hellenic team across Ireland and Northern Ireland.
A proud moment after a long process. This will be a great addition to our 24/7 portfolio with these fantastic local brands.
